gantrytips.tip: Select if you want to show our prestyled pagination at your website. If it is OFF selected the default Wordpress pagination will be used.
Here you can write in your custom text for read more link.
Here you can change various content display options ie. meta data display or the page title appearance. These changes will only affect the Blog page type.
Here you can change various content display options ie. meta data display or the page title appearance. These changes will only affect the Page page type.
Here you can change various contact page display options. These changes will only affect the Contact page type.
Here you can change various content display options ie. meta data display or the page title appearance. These changes will only affect the Post page type.
Here you can change various content display options ie. meta data display or the page title appearance. These changes will only affect the Category page type.
Here you can change various content display options ie. meta data display or the page title appearance. These changes will only affect the Archive page type.
Here you can change various content display options ie. meta data display or the page title appearance. These changes will only affect the Tags page type.
Here you can change various content display options ie. meta data display or the page title appearance. These changes will only affect the Search page type.
Here you can create your own custom html 404 Page.

In the Blog Category setting you can enter the Category ID that you would like to use for your Blog Page. It is possible to enter multiple ID's separated by comma or exclude certain categories by adding "minus" in front of the ID, such as -6 to exclude the category with ID 6.
Here you can write a count of your posts in category.
This option lets you to specify what type of content should your Blog Query return.

You have 2 choices from the dropdown on how you would like to display the Blog Content: 1. Content, which will show your blog posts content up to 'Read More' tag and 2. Excerpt, which is a condensed description of your blog post and refers to the summary entered in the Excerpt field of the post.

There are many possible choices available for you to select the order in which your posts will be shown. Some examples are Author, Comment Count, Date, Parent and Random to only name a few. Use the dropdown to select which order suits your needs best.
This setting allows you to display the Page Title above all your posts on the blog page. Leaving this field empty will remove that title.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the titles of your posts in the blog page.
With this setting you can select whether or not to have the titles of your posts in the blog page linked.
Select if the thumbnail in blog will be displayed in lightbox.
With this setting you can select whether or not to have the read more link in the blog page.
If you would like to display the Author along with your blog posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Number of Comments along with your blog posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to Link the Number of Comments to your comments on blog posts, enable this setting.

Here you can create the Custom Query that's used to generate the blog page content on your site. You can use different parameters specified in the WordPress query_posts function, but you need to maintain the proper syntax ie. author=1&tag=tag1&year=2009. Please see this link for list of possible parameters : http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/query_posts
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the title of your page in the page view.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the title link of your page in the page view.
You can choose from four title styles for your page. Just try it!
If you would like to display the Author along with your page content, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Number of Comments along with your page content, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Add New Comment Form inside of your page content, enable this setting.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the title of your contact page.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the title link of your contact page.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the contact info.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the contact mail.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the contact form.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the google map.
With this setting you can choose the width of your google map.
With this setting you can choose the height of your google map.
Here you can write your e-mail subject.
With this setting you can select whether or not to use captcha.
Here you can write your thanks message.
Here you can write your error message for name.
Here you can write your error message for mail.
Here you can write your error message for text.
Here you can write your error message for captcha.
Here you can write your label submit button.
Here you can write your label name input.
Here you can write your label mail input.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the title of your post in the single post view.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the title link of your post.
You can choose from four styles for your posts. Just try it!
Select if the thumbnail in post will be displayed in lightbox.
If you would like to display the Author along with your post content, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Number of Comments along with your post content, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Tags under your post content, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Post Footer under your post content, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Add New Comment Form inside of your post content, enable this setting.
Here you can enable or disable displaying of twitter button.
Here you can enable or disable displaying of google plus button.
Here you can enable or disable displaying of facebook button and choose a location - for english speaking countries it is en_US.
Here you can type the number of results per page that the Category page will display.

You have 2 choices from the dropdown on how you would like to display the Category Content: 1. Content, which will show your blog posts content up to 'Read More' tag and 2. Excerpt, which is a condensed description of your blog post and refers to the summary entered in the Excerpt field of the post.
You can choose from six styles for your category blog. Just try it!
Here you can write the title which will be displayed by your category.
Here you can write the description which will be displayed by your category.
Select if the thumbnail in category will be displayed in lightbox.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the read more link by your category.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the title by your category.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the titles of your posts in category.
With this setting you can select whether or not to have the titles of your posts in the category page linked.
If you would like to display the Author along with your category posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Number of Comments along with your category posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to Link the Number of Comments to your comments on category posts, enable this setting.
Here you can type the number of results per page that the Archive page will display.

You have 2 choices from the dropdown on how you would like to display the Archive Content: 1. Content, which will show your blog posts content up to 'Read More' tag and 2. Excerpt, which is a condensed description of your blog post and refers to the summary entered in the Excerpt field of the post.
You can choose from four blog styles for your archive. Just try it!
Select if the thumbnail in archive will be displayed in lightbox.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the read more link by your archive.
Here you can enable or disable displaying of the page title ie. "Category : ...", "Archive for ..." etc.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the titles of your posts in the archive page.
With this setting you can select whether or not to have the titles of your posts in the archive page linked.
If you would like to display the Author along with your archive posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Number of Comments along with your archive posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to Link the Number of Comments to your comments on archive posts, enable this setting.
Here you can type the number of results per page that the Tag page will display.

You have 2 choices from the dropdown on how you would like to display the Tag Content: 1. Content, which will show your blog posts content up to 'Read More' tag and 2. Excerpt, which is a condensed description of your blog post and refers to the summary entered in the Excerpt field of the post.
You can choose from four blog styles for your tags. Just try it!
Select if the thumbnail in archive will be displayed in tags.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the read more link by your tags.
Here you can write the title which will be displayed by your tags.
Here you can enable or disable displaying of the page title ie. "Category : ...", "Archive for ..." etc.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the titles of your posts in the tag page.
With this setting you can select whether or not to have the titles of your posts in the tag page linked.
If you would like to display the Author along with your tagged posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Number of Comments along with your tagged posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to Link the Number of Comments to your comments on tagged posts, enable this setting.
Here you can type the number of results per page that the Search page will display.

You have 2 choices from the dropdown on how you would like to display the Search Content: 1. Content, which will show your blog posts content up to 'Read More' tag and 2. Excerpt, which is a condensed description of your blog post and refers to the summary entered in the Excerpt field of the post.
You can choose from four blog styles for your search. Just try it!
Select if the thumbnail in archive will be displayed in search.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the read more link by your tags.
Here you can enable or disable displaying of the page title ie. "Category : ...", "Archive for ..." etc.
With this setting you can select whether or not to show the titles of your posts in the search page.
With this setting you can select whether or not to have the titles of your posts in the search page linked.
If you would like to display the Author along with your searched posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to display the Number of Comments along with your searched posts, enable this setting.
If you would like to Link the Number of Comments to your comments on searched posts, enable this setting.
